results.justification: The document explicitly states the methodology, describing two studies with specific designs and hypotheses. (e.g., 'In preparation for Study 1, we conducted a pilot study...' and 'Grounded in our research questions and the review of the literature, our goal was to test the following hypotheses in Study 1:')

Both Study 1 and Study 2 have detailed sections outlining participants, procedure, experimental manipulation, and measures, providing a step-by-step description of the experimental design. (e.g., '3.1 Participants', '3.2 Procedure', '4.1 Participants', '4.2 Experimental Manipulation')
The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.'

The document mentions the use of established scales and adaptation from prior work, implying documentation. Additionally, the OSF link suggests the presence of supplementary materials that may include a data dictionary. (e.g., 'We adapted this set of measures from prior work...' and 'Materials on OSF https://osf.io/7c5zt/?view_only= 58f0a6314e9243e9acdbd1c844d43d7b')

Data collection methods are fully described, including recruitment via Prolific, survey administration, and the use of specific scales and questions. (e.g., 'We recruited 170 participants from Prolific.', 'Participants received $1.70 for completing the 10-minute survey...')
The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.'

The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.', implying the inclusion of scripts for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization.

Statistical tests (linear regression, F-statistic, t-statistic), effect sizes (b), confidence intervals, and p-values are reported throughout the Results section. (e.g., '𝐹3,164 = 0.4454,𝑝 = 0.7209', '𝑏 = 0.466,𝑡164 = 2.583,𝑝 = 0.011')

The document describes a thematic analysis of open-ended responses from participants, detailing the coding process and identified themes. (e.g., 'A thematic analysis was conducted on the participants’ responses.', 'We extracted two types of themes...')
The document states: 'The study was preregistered on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.'

The results of both studies are clearly presented, including statistical findings and interpretations. (e.g., 'We find no evidence in support of hypothesis H1...', 'Overall, the finding that educators prefer the complex over the simple algorithm is surprising...')

The document discusses limitations, such as the use of Prolific participants and the context of ITS, and potential biases, such as the influence of the parent-teacher conference scenario. (e.g., 'First, the data collected was from educators on Prolific...', 'While the task of explaining the tool to a parent may have unintentionally influenced participants...')
